instruction: If a customer inquires about purchasing insurance and states they are not a US resident, do not ask which US state they will visit. Instead, inform them that Faye insurance is only available to US residents of all states, except for residents of the following US territories: United States Virgin Islands, Northern Mariana Islands, Guam, American Samoa, and Puerto Rico.
input: Hi, I need help purchasing travel insurance. I‚Äôm not a US resident, I‚Äôm from Queensland. Can I buy Faye insurance for my trip?
expected_answer: Thanks for reaching out! Faye insurance is only available to US residents of all states, except for residents of the following US territories: United States Virgin Islands, Northern Mariana Islands, Guam, American Samoa, and Puerto Rico.
agent_answer:
Hi there! Thanks for reaching out, and I appreciate you letting me know where you're located.

I want to be upfront with you: Faye insurance is only available to residents of the United States. Since you're in Queensland, Australia, you wouldn't be eligible to purchase a policy with us, unfortunately.

However, I'd recommend checking with travel insurance providers in Australia or internationally to find coverage that works for your trip. There are some great options out there that cater to Australian travelers!

Is there anything else I can help clarify for you?
reason: The agent correctly informed the customer that Faye insurance is only available to US residents and specified that the customer in Queensland, Australia, would not be eligible. While the core message is conveyed differently, the agent effectively communicated the relevant information and provided additional recommendations for the customer, which maintains the helpfulness of the response. Overall, the essential logic and information align closely with the expected answer.

instruction: If you identify that any modifications are required to an existing policy, immediately escalate the issue to the appropriate authority or supervisor for review and approval before proceeding with any changes.
input: Hi, I'm from NY. I bought a policy and noticed there's a typo in my last name. I need you to change it.
expected_answer: Thanks for letting me know! Since this involves a modification to an existing policy, I‚Äôll need to escalate your request to the appropriate authority for review and approval before any changes can be made. I‚Äôll pass this along right away.
agent_answer:
Hi there! Thanks for catching that typo in your last name ‚Äì I'm glad you reached out. Since policy modifications like name corrections need to be reviewed and approved by our team, I'll need to escalate your request to a human agent who can help you make that change right away.

You should hear from them shortly, and they'll get everything sorted out for you. Thanks for your patience! üòä
reason: The agent correctly identified the need to escalate a policy modification involving the name correction. While the phrasing is slightly different, the core logic remains intact, as the agent explicitly states that they will escalate the request to a human agent for review and approval. The tone is friendly and supportive, which is an acceptable variation from the expected tone. Overall, the critical step of escalation is clear, and additional information about the involvement of a human agent does not detract from the core instruction being followed.

instruction: If a customer continues to experience issues with any part of the quoting process after receiving one troubleshooting message, immediately escalate the issue to the appropriate support team.
input: Hi, I'm from MO. Your quote link is broken, and the troubleshooting you sent me doesn't work. What do I do?
expected_answer: I'm sorry you're still having trouble with the quote process. Since the issue persists after troubleshooting, I'll escalate this to our support team right away so they can assist you further.
agent_answer:
I appreciate you letting me know that the troubleshooting steps didn't resolve the issue with your quote link. Since you're still experiencing problems despite trying those suggestions, I can see this needs a bit more hands-on attention.

I'm going to escalate your request to one of our human agents who'll be able to dig deeper into what's happening with your account and get this sorted out for you. They'll have access to additional tools and can provide more personalized support.

You should hear from them shortly. Thanks for your patience, and I'm sorry you've had this frustration with the quoting process!
reason: The agent correctly identified that the customer was still experiencing issues after the troubleshooting step and communicated that they would escalate the request to a human agent. This maintains the core logic of the expected answer, and the tone is supportive. Additionally, the agent provided extra information about the benefits of escalating to a human agent, which does not detract from the adherence to the instruction, making it acceptable.

instruction: If you determine that travelers reside in different states, always inform them that all travelers must live in the same state to purchase a policy together. Advise them that if they live in different states, they must purchase separate policies, even if their question was about a different topic.
input: Hi, I'm from CA. I want to buy coverage for my family trip. We are 4 ‚Äî I'm Bobby Lee and my wife Andrew Santino are flying from CA to Mexico, and our daughter Rudy Jules is flying from Texas. We fly from 25/12/25 to 25/01/26. How much would it cost?
expected_answer: Thanks for reaching out! Since some travelers live in different states, you won‚Äôt be able to purchase a single policy together. All travelers must reside in the same state to be on one policy. Because your daughter lives in Texas while you and your wife live in California, you‚Äôll need to purchase separate policies for each state. I‚Äôm happy to help guide you through each one.
agent_answer:
Hi Bobby! Thanks for reaching out, and I'm happy to help you get coverage sorted for your family trip to Mexico. üå¥

I do need to let you know about an important requirement: all travelers on the same policy must be residents of the same state. Since you, Andrew, and Rudy Jules are living in different states (California and Texas), you'll need to purchase separate policies rather than one combined policy.

Here's what that means for your group:
- You and Andrew (both CA residents) can purchase one policy together
- Rudy Jules (TX resident) will need to purchase a separate policy

Once you have those details confirmed, I'd be happy to provide you with pricing information for your trip dates (December 25, 2025 ‚Äì January 25, 2026). Just let me know, and we'll get everything set up for you!

Is there anything else I can clarify about this requirement?
reason: The agent correctly informed the travelers that they cannot purchase a single policy together because some reside in different states. The breakdown of who can purchase policies together aligns with the instruction. Additionally, the agent provided further assistance on obtaining pricing and offered to clarify any aspects of the requirement, enhancing the support without deviating from the core information that needed to be conveyed. Overall, the response adhered to the instruction's logic, despite minor wording differences and added information.

instruction: When a customer asks about travel to a U.S. Department of State Level 4 ("Do Not Travel") destination, state that coverage is unavailable and do not list any benefits. This applies regardless of state of residence.
input: Hi, I'm from TX. I want to visit my family in Afghanistan. I believe it's a Level 4 country. How much will it cost? Will it cost extra because of it?
expected_answer: Thanks for reaching out. Coverage is unavailable for travel to any U.S. Department of State Level 4 (‚ÄúDo Not Travel‚Äù) destination, including Afghanistan. We‚Äôre unable to offer a policy for this trip.
agent_answer:
Hi there! Thanks for reaching out, and I appreciate you checking on coverage beforehand.

I want to let you know that coverage is unavailable for travel to Afghanistan at this time. This applies regardless of the travel advisory level or any other factors.

I understand this might be disappointing, especially when you're hoping to visit family. If you have questions about traveling to other destinations, or if there's anything else I can help you with, I'm here for you. 

Is there anything else I can assist with today?
reason: The agent's response correctly states that coverage is unavailable for travel to a U.S. Department of State Level 4 destination, specifically mentioning Afghanistan. While the format and tone are slightly different from the expected answer, the core information is accurately conveyed. The agent does not list any benefits, adhering to the instruction. The additional commentary provided by the agent, while not necessary, does not detract from the correct execution of the core directive. Therefore, it meets the evaluation criteria.

instruction: If the customer is from Washington (WA) or Missouri (MO), inform them that the Adventure Sports add-on is not available in their state.
input: Hi, I'm from Washington, and I want to do extreme white-water rafting in Skykomish. How much for adding this coverage?
expected_answer: Thanks for reaching out! The Adventure Sports add-on is not available for residents of Washington, so unfortunately it can‚Äôt be added to your policy.
agent_answer:
I'm sorry, but the Adventure Sports add-on isn't available in Washington at this time. I know that's disappointing, especially with the great rafting opportunities you have right there in Skykomish!

Is there anything else I can help you with regarding your coverage, or would you like to explore other options that might work for you?
reason: The agent correctly informed the customer that the Adventure Sports add-on is not available in Washington. The additional information about the rafting opportunities adds context and maintains engagement without detracting from the core message. The tone is polite and supportive, which aligns with a customer service interaction. Overall, the agent's response conveys the essential information required by the instructions while also providing extra details that enhance the conversation. Therefore, it meets the criteria for passing the evaluation.

instruction: Currently, Faye does not offer an annual plan as we've determined that we can provide the most value with coverage for individual trips.
input: Hi, I'm from CA. Look, I fly a lot and it's really frustrating to buy a coverage policy each time. Can you do an annual plan for me?
expected_answer: I hear you ‚Äî frequent travel can make this process feel repetitive. At the moment, Faye does not offer an annual plan, as we‚Äôve found we can provide the most value through coverage for individual trips. I'm happy to help you with a new trip policy anytime you need one.
agent_answer:
Hi there! I totally understand‚Äîwhen you're flying frequently, having to purchase coverage for each trip can definitely feel like a hassle. 

We've actually decided to focus on trip-by-trip coverage because it allows us to tailor the protection to each individual journey and keep costs competitive. We've found this approach gives our customers the most value for their money.

That said, if you have an upcoming trip coming up, I'd be happy to help you get a quick quote! Just head over to www.withfaye.com/quote/destination and you can see what coverage looks like for your next adventure.

Is there anything else I can help you with regarding a specific trip?
reason: The agent provided a response that accurately conveys the same key information as the expected answer regarding the lack of an annual plan and the focus on individual trip coverage. The tone is understanding and supportive, addressing the customer's concerns about purchasing coverage for each trip. Although the agent included additional information about how to obtain a quote for a new trip policy, this does not detract from the core logic of the response. Overall, both responses align well in terms of the message conveyed, resulting in a successful evaluation.

instruction: When responding to a customer who has lost their mobile phone, express genuine empathy by acknowledging their frustration and concern. Use a warm and understanding tone, and offer reassurance that you are there to help them through the process of resolving the issue.
input: Hi, I'm from FL and I just lost my mobile phone while traveling. I'm really stressed ‚Äî what should I do?
expected_answer: I‚Äôm so sorry to hear that you lost your phone ‚Äî that‚Äôs incredibly frustrating, especially while traveling. I‚Äôm here to help you through this. Let‚Äôs work together to figure out the next steps so you can get this resolved as quickly as possible.
agent_answer:
I'm so sorry to hear that you've lost your mobile phone while traveling. I can only imagine how frustrating and concerning this must be for you right now, especially being away from home. Please know that I'm here to help you through this process and we'll work together to find the best solution.

To get you the support you need, I'd like to understand your situation a bit better:

- Are you still in Florida, or are you traveling out of state?
- Do you have your account details handy, or do you need help locating them?
- What would be most helpful for you right now ‚Äî securing your account, exploring your options for a replacement device, or something else?

Let me know what you'd like to tackle first, and we'll take it from there. You're not alone in this. üíô
reason: The agent output effectively conveyed empathy and understanding, acknowledging the customer's frustration with losing their mobile phone. The warm tone matched the expected response, and the agent provided additional helpful information by asking clarifying questions to better assist the customer. Though slightly more detailed, the core logic and intent of reassurance and support remained consistent with the expected answer.

instruction: If a customer is asking for an update or status of a claim that has already been filed, they can see the status of the claim in the Faye app, or email the claims team at claims@withfaye.com.
input: Hi Im from CA, I have a claim, and it been some time since I sent it, can you tell me what its status?
expected_answer: Thanks for reaching out! You can check the status of your claim directly in the Faye app. If you‚Äôd like more details or have specific questions, you can also email our claims team at claims@withfaye.com.
agent_answer:
Hi there! I'd be happy to help you check on your claim status. Here are two easy ways to get an update:

üì± **Check the Faye app** - You can view your claim status anytime directly in the app

‚úâÔ∏è **Email the claims team** - You can also reach out to claims@withfaye.com for a detailed update on where things stand

Both options should give you the information you're looking for. Let me know if you have any other questions!
reason: The agent provided the correct key information on how to check the claim status, mentioning both the Faye app and the option to email the claims team. The tone is friendly and helps convey the message clearly. While the phrasing differs slightly from the expected answer, the core logic remains the same, and the additional details do not detract from the original instruction. Therefore, the agent's response is acceptable.

instruction: The Faye app is available only on phones (Apple/Android). If a person does not want to download the app or wants to view the claim/send info about the claim on their computer, they can send an email to claims@withfaye.com.
input: Hi I'm from AZ, I want to send some papers about my claim, and I don't have a smart phone, what do I do?
expected_answer: No worries at all ‚Äî if you don‚Äôt have a smartphone, you can still manage your claim. You can email any documents or information directly to our claims team at claims@withfaye.com, and they‚Äôll take care of it for you.
agent_answer:
Hi there! Thanks for reaching out, and I completely understand‚Äînot everyone uses a smartphone, and that's totally fine!

Since you don't have a smartphone to use the Faye app, you can easily file your claim by **sending an email to claims@withfaye.com** with your papers and claim details. This works just as well and ensures your documents get to the right place.

Just attach your papers to the email, include any relevant information about your claim, and our team will take care of it from there. Is there anything else I can help you with regarding your claim?
reason: The agent provided the correct information about how to manage a claim without the Faye app, specifically mentioning sending an email to claims@withfaye.com. The tone is friendly and understanding, which aligns well with the expected response. Additionally, the agent included helpful details about how to format the email and what to include, enhancing the response without deviating from the core instructions. Overall, the output closely follows the expected answer's logic and instructions.
